pros: There are a few kind individuals who love God and are truly here to serve him (but they usually end up leaving). Employee benefits are good.
cons:
It was truly a disappointment to find out that a ministry that is so internationally respected and presented so well across the world harbors a toxic work environment for its employees. Starting with Franklin, the company is ran with a “rules for thee and not for me” mentality. They pay people way under their worth, all in the name of “ministry”. Inappropriate behaviors and comments are made by leadership and left unaddressed. Unfortunately, young people are not respected by leadership and their ideas or contributions are most often dismissed. 

BGEA does not exemplify their hallmark of “unity” where employees are encouraged to work together, instead there is a lot of internal backbiting and manipulation. Because the employees are Christians, many leave and keep their opinions about the toxic work environment to themselves. My only hopes in writing this review is to save others from taking a job here.

pros: Cafeteria lunch is great. Kind people

pros: amazing God lovers with nice hearts

review_title: My Personal Review Pros and Cons
pros: Christian environment, rewarding to pray and help others.
cons: Stressful at times.  Response room workers were not allowed to attend morning devotions.  Part-time workers often worked full-time hours but were not eligible for benefits.  Franklin Graham gave all the full-time workers bibles, but part-time workers received nothing.  Billy Graham was kind and charming.  When he came to visit once, it took time to reach out to shake my hand, even though he was on a walker.   His photographer took pictures and I receive copies.  The highlight of my time working there.

pros: They have great benefits and there are some great people there if you can find them. They also have an in-house dining area filled with great food, so you don't have to worry about going out at lunch.
cons: Unfortunately, the length of time you have worked there means if you will be listened to. Being one of the few younger people in the building (under 30), I often was treated like a child. The standards that they hold a newer/younger person to are much higher to the standard of someone who has been there for a longer time. If I had anything to say about ways to connect with people, my ideas were never truly considered due to them not going with the tradition of the company. Because my personality didn't fit with some of the people in my department, they made up stories to take to management about me in hopes to get me fired or to leave. Finally, there was no where to move up to the next level in my position.

review_title: Loved the people and Spirituality. Great Perks, stressfull due to lack of communication between managers and employees.
pros: Loved going to work everyday. Morning Devotions of entire building was a HUGE perk!!  Being able to share the Gospel and win souls for Christ was awesome. They were very understanding of time off for Doctors Appointments, etc...
cons: Not just one trainer but many and each one had a different idea of how to do things. They would change how they wanted you to do things many times a day. Many times they would contradict each other. Hard to know how they wanted the job to be done. Upper Management did not keep supervisors informed of changes in a timely manner.

job_title: Christian Response Representative and Webmaster in Charlotte, NC
pros: It was a great work environment, encouraging gospel-centered work, prayer, and family values. I worked with some great people too. The cafeteria was also an amazing blessing.
cons: The upper-level leadership was seemingly unreachable. There was an odd "us & them" mentality. The CEO's controversial public statements often put employees in tough situations. There were few young people working in the organization. Tradition often triumphed creativity and ingenuity. Problems were rarely solved.

pros:
In-house dining
Benefits and compensation are in line with other companies
Nice people to work with. Not sure if that is because they would be fired if they are not nice or if they are generally just nice people. The people I knew and became friends with were "real".
The work done is for a greater cause and it is admirable.
cons: Management needs to listen to the little people. Stop making decisions for a department when you have never done the work that dept. actually does. Many are unhappy but will not leave because of economy. Hey, we are all replaceable, right?

pros: Benefits are good. Great work-life balance.
cons: No room for advancement.  Moral among employees are low due to a lot of favoritism among departments which is . With this being a non profit Christian organization, it is no different than corporate America. You still have to deal with people being promoted based on who they know and not what they know to hold a position .

review_title: Volunteer at the Billy Graham Library
job_title: Volunteer At the BGEA Library in Charlotte, NC
pros: Wonderful group of people to work with, positive work environment, professional organization.
cons: Nothing negative. All I will say is it is tough to get your "foot in the door" here, in a permanent position. This is because they want the highest caliber of person, from an education and experience standpoint.  So while it may be difficult to land a job here, it is a positive that they seek the best of the best, to represent the organization and it's mission.

pros: Christian ministry.. Devotions every morning.. Generally good people to work around. Dining room offers great meals.
cons: Not everyone acts "Christian". In my role as Material Handler, management lacked the necessary experience to efficiently operate BGEA's warehouse. Warehouse supervisor has an attitude problem. HR is not always on your side.. Top management officials are totally out of touch with lower leveled employees.

job_title: Retail Store Manager in Asheville, NC
pros: Christian based non-profit organization that allows each employee to feel part of the team and the importance and value of every employee.
cons: The dynamics of event driven work makes for uneven work flow which can result in added stress to accomplish everything that is expected.

review_title: The organization has had a significant impact across the world.
pros: There are a lot of really great people working for BGEA. The organization has had a significant impact across the globe. The organization remains committed to Dr. Graham's mission of sharing the Gospel through every means possible.
cons: Communication across the organization could be improved. There are lots of starts/stops/changes in direction that cause additional stress for staff in trying to meet deadlines.
